title: Today I uninstalled.
body:
Six year player, saw all the backtracking on solo queue, and I'm done. I know this post will be trolled and downvoted to oblivion, but I felt the need to make it.

Thanks, League, it's been an awesome time. You've consumed my life and kept me entertained for so long. As a strictly solo player, I've really tried to embrace dynamic queue, but all the little negatives about it have added up to where I'm not enjoying my games anymore. Solo queue was my hope for the game, and all the backtracking and delays is so classic Riot that I would not be surprised if it never comes out. 

If it does, you have a six year playing customer coming back with gusto. If not, I really enjoyed the time I played. Thanks for the memories.

> Six year player here. Have uninstalled League like, 3 times in the past 4 months. Preseason and season 6 is just disgusting. Balance, goals, the purposeful catering of specific champions (Zed, who the community warned Riot would get out of hand with the introduction of Duskblade and now we're finally getting word of him a month and a week later), the gutting of most AP-based champions followed by the buffing of most AD-based champions. Many mages have had their win rates plummet, and Riot's solution is to buff them instead of reevaluating AP items in general (which they finally are for the mid year mage update, but only minimally).
> 
> I have a hard time bringing myself into playing this game. I used to NO-LIFE this game hardcore, between being jobless, between classes, and between work. Now, I play 2-3 games a day, even on my free days. I told myself I'd quit once I got into Overwatch beta, or when Overwatch releases... which should be around the time Mid Year Mage Update releases, which will be my last straw. Same bro.
They did like a hundred stupid things in a row to screw this game from the start of preseason6 and they haven't stopped even now.
I've been a no life hardcore player of this game as well, I couldn't imagine it won't be enjoyable to me anymore someday, but Riot managed to make it, thank Riot, for the first time in 5 years I'm bored of this game.

This comment resonates with me so hard.  This time last year, I could not have imagined leaving league.  All of the surveys I filled out were extremely positive, and I always said I'd recommend the game to friends.  I felt really good with spending money on RP because it seemed like an investment that wasn't going away any time soon.

It absolutely blows my mind how much they screwed up in 6 months.

Haven't played in a couple months now, and at this point, there's too many other competitive games coming out for me to see myself coming back to a worse version of what I left.

I'm not really saying this to complain - just that I'm absolutely floored at how much they managed to change in the past 6 months that is (imo) for the worse.  Just baffled.

I feel exactly the same way. I didn't play much for the past few months as I've been in school and such, and I finally had a little time this week and thought I'd try and play a little bit and it's like an entirely different game. 
It seems like for the first 4 seasons they knew they had a good game and just built on and tweaked it in small ways. Then in season 5 they started making bigger changes, but generally pretty well thought out and well explained changes. But then near the end of 5 and preseason 6 things just started changing out of the blue for seemingly no reason other than for the purpose of being newer and shinier. I honestly hardly recognize the game anymore it's just becoming so far from what it once was.
At this point the only reason I play is if I have friends who want to do something together. If I'm on my own, I'm just gonna go to smite or HotS.

I feel cheated. I've spent so much money on this game and now Riot is shitting all over it. I don't know what to do, but I know one thing for sure. Riot will never get a penny from me again.

Yeah fuck this whole situation. Dynamic Queue should have been the experiment to follow the new champ select in solo queue. Solo would be so much easier to implement. Queue times would be way shorter and matchmaking would be better. More people would be getting the roles they wanted if you only had to pick 10 random individuals from an entire pool of individual players, instead of this nonsense where they have to sort through the various different sized premade groups. 

Fuck dynamic queue. Ranked should always be solo unless its full teams, no in-between.

I mean, I'd agree with most things except that "most people would get the roles they wanted", that's flat out wrong. I mean, I'm fine with them postponing solo queue, or even removing it completely, as long as I see some solid improvements to dynamic queue.

Sorry, but I'm not exactly wrong on this. There's no system where everyone will get their chosen role 100% of the time, yes, BUT if the system needs to choose from a pool of individual players matchmaking would have a much easier time sorting things out than the current system that also has party size as an extra variable. A **very** restrictive variable at that.
Team Builder had a person get their position 100% of the time. Mostly because it didn't force a Secondary Role but who knows what it could be?
I mean, at least wait until they actually announce solo queue's death.

There was a post where Riot Socrates said "there is a world in which solo que doesnt exist", basically using the complications Riot is having with dynamic que as a bullshit excuse to open the window for not releasing solo que.
I'm aware of the post and its implications. I'm just saying that it's not yet 100% certain.
You don't need to be an expert in PR and damage-controlese to understand the meaning of that post.

Just the fact that you have that one tiny inkling of faith is a victory for Riot

It is nothing new, and they've done it quite a few times before.

At the risk of being downvoted  (i don't really care) and sounding like a douche, we don't need people who threaten to quit or close their wallets the moment Riot makes a decision. With every buff or nerf, with every new feature and decommissioning the old one, you get these people who feel the need to announce they are leaving - you were fine all this time with being anon so what changed?

With this kind of a post, you are not discussing anything or making an argument about this matter. It's your resolution and your way of making an ultimatum "Either i get this or i leave". Not to mention that when you get to "enjoy" your ranked experience, threads with these keywords usually pop up: "getting banned; trolls; toxic; bronze; etc". I think you can guess what kind of threads they are.

You were never forced to pay for the game. You were never forced to play the game.
You were doing it on your own merit.
It's fine to not have fun with the game anymore, maybe it has run its course but saying that one change ruined it for you - people can be very melodramatic sometimes, just to make a scene.
---
It's nothing personal. You are no one. I am no one. Leave quietly.
##You are not going to be missed.
#Enjoy whatever awaits you on the other side.

I mean this is just one post of many from long-time players of the game who are just baffled at the state it has ended up in. As someone who started in season 1 it's just incredibly how little of this game I even understand anymore after taking just a couple months off. The item pool is drastically different, there are entirely new objectives, many progression systems no longer work the same, and dozens of champions have been reworks in really bizarre ways. It just feels like Riot is making changes so that they can call things new rather than actually trying to make improvements on the game.

The whole reason Riot was even doing these changes is to improve the game.
If you think they're making changes for the sake of making changes, you're wrong.

I'm not happy with the new season mostly for the fact that there is basically a pool of 25 champs in every single game. "Balanced" IMO just means you have the capability to pick a large range of the 120+ champs and feel good about it going into a game for the most part. There's always a top tier group but this time it has been a little ridiculous.

That being said, take a look at the 6.6 patch notes and the upcoming PBE notes and almost everything that has been OP lately is getting a nerf, and I'm pretty happy with that. 

Lastly, I have an honest question for anyone agreeing with these posts about "I'm done", and that is where are you seeing these overly significant differences in gameplay with >2 man parties over the past single/duo queue (APART from the champ issues)? I duo typically 80% of my ranked games (or solo, never more) and have honestly not noticed much of a difference, especially not enough to be like WOW this is bad.
